comments:
This is a major problem because you cannot get access to the entire help system.
I am currently using 3.1RC1-1 but this bug also applies to 3.1

There is quite a lot of debug info which I am going to email to you at
platform-help-inbox@eclipse.org as soon as I have a bug report number.

eclipse Bugzilla 98443 Help File System broken
 From: Vizion <vizion@vizion.occoxmail.com>
 To: freebsd-java@freebsd.org
 
I have now distilled the information on the eclipse help bug which has now 
been posted to eclipse bugzilla under the reference number above.

Bug Report details
Subject: eclipse Bugzilla 98443 Help File System broken
Date: Sunday 05 June 2005 09:22
From: Vizion <vizion@vizion.occoxmail.com>
To: zhoujx@cn.ibm.com, kowalski@us.ibm.com, mfaraj@ca.ibm.com, 
konradk@ca.ibm.com, dejan@ca.ibm.com, dejan@ca.ibm.com, 
platform-help-inbox@eclipse.org,  freebsd-java@freebsd.org, Alex Varju 
<alex@varju.ca>

Hi
Ok this bug is causing a number of people considerable grief..there seems to
be something wrong with the way in which the help system operates. I am
including in this email as much information as seems relevant but more is
available if required. Therre have been a series of emails which have been
made on freebsd-java@freebsd.org and on the eclipse newsgroup which are quite
lengthy but the essential information is in this report.
The platform is PC and in my case the operating system is FreeBSD 5.3.
alex@varju.ca is included in the distribution list as the freebsd maintainer
for the eclipse port.
Information now follows:

A. Build:
**************************
Here is the Makefile that produced a clean build of 3.1RC1 on my system:

dns1# cat Makefile
# New ports collection makefile for:    eclipse-devel
# Date created:                         April 9, 2005
# Whom:                                 various members of freebsd-java
#
# $FreeBSD: ports/java/eclipse-devel/Makefile,v 1.2 2005/05/29 03:41:41 nork
Exp $
#

PORTNAME=       eclipse
PORTVERSION=    3.1RC1
CATEGORIES=     java devel
MASTER_SITES=   ${MASTER_SITE_ECLIPSE}
MASTER_SITE_SUBDIR=     S-${PORTVERSION}-200505271300
DISTNAME=       ${PORTNAME}-sourceBuild-srcIncluded-${PORTVERSION}
DIST_SUBDIR=    eclipse

MAINTAINER=     freebsd-ports@varju.ca
COMMENT=        An open extensible IDE for anything and nothing in particular

BUILD_DEPENDS=  ant:${PORTSDIR}/devel/apache-ant \
                zip:${PORTSDIR}/archivers/zip
BUILD_DEPENDS+= ${EXTRACT_DEPENDS}

CONFLICTS=      eclipse-3.0*
LATEST_LINK=    ${PORTNAME}-devel

ONLY_FOR_ARCHS= i386 amd64
USE_GMAKE=      yes
USE_ZIP=        yes
USE_GCC=        3.4

USE_JAVA=       yes
JAVA_VERSION=   1.4+
JAVA_OS=        native

USE_REINPLACE=  yes
NO_WRKSUBDIR=   yes

PORTDESTDIR=    ${PREFIX}/eclipse

ECLIPSE_OS=     freebsd

.if defined(WITH_MOTIF)
ECLIPSE_WS=     motif
USE_ICONV=      yes
USE_MOTIF=      yes
.else
ECLIPSE_WS=     gtk
.if defined(WITH_MOZILLA)
BROWSER=        ${WITH_MOZILLA}
BUILD_DEPENDS+= ${BROWSER}:${PORTSDIR}/www/${BROWSER}
.else
BUILD_DEPENDS+= mozilla:${PORTSDIR}/www/mozilla
BROWSER=        mozilla
.endif
.endif

.if defined(WITHOUT_GNOMEVFS)
MAKE_GNOME=
USE_GNOME=      gtk20 pkgconfig
.else
MAKE_GNOME=     make_gnome
USE_GNOME=      gtk20 gnomevfs2 libgnome libgnomeui pkgconfig
.endif

.include <bsd.port.pre.mk>

.if defined(WITH_MOTIF)
BROKEN= No motif support yet
.endif

.if (${ARCH} == "amd64")
ECLIPSE_ARCH=   amd64
ECLIPSE_SWT=    gtk64
.else
ECLIPSE_ARCH=   x86
ECLIPSE_SWT=    gtk
.endif

.if (${BROWSER} == "firefox")
BROKEN= Firefox integration doesn\'t work yet
.endif

MAKE_ENV+=      BROWSER=${BROWSER} \
                ECLIPSE_ARCH=${ECLIPSE_ARCH} \
                ECLIPSE_OS=${ECLIPSE_OS} \
                ECLIPSE_WS=${ECLIPSE_WS} \
                JAVA_HOME=${JAVA_HOME} \
                MAKE_GNOME=${MAKE_GNOME} \
                MOTIF_HOME=${X11_HOME} \
                QT_HOME=${X11_HOME}

PLIST_FILES=    bin/eclipse

SWTGTK=${WRKSRC}/plugins/org.eclipse.swt/Eclipse SWT PI/gtk/library
SWTMOTIF=${WRKSRC}/plugins/org.eclipse.swt/Eclipse SWT PI/motif/library

# Manually patch some files with spaces in the path
post-patch:
        @${PATCH} ${PATCH_DIST_ARGS} "${SWTMOTIF}/build.sh" \
          ${FILESDIR}/manualpatch-plugins-swt-motif-build.sh
        @${PATCH} ${PATCH_DIST_ARGS} "${SWTMOTIF}/make_freebsd.mak" \
          ${FILESDIR}/manualpatch-plugins-swt-motif-make_freebsd.mak
        @${PATCH} ${PATCH_DIST_ARGS} "${SWTGTK}/make_freebsd.mak" \
          ${FILESDIR}/manualpatch-plugins-swt-gtk-make_freebsd.mak
        @${PATCH} ${PATCH_DIST_ARGS} "${SWTGTK}/build.sh" \
          ${FILESDIR}/manualpatch-plugins-swt-gtk-build.sh
        @${PATCH} ${PATCH_DIST_ARGS} "${SWTGTK}/os_custom.h" \
          ${FILESDIR}/manualpatch-plugins-swt-gtk-os_custom.h

do-build:
        @(cd ${WRKSRC}; ${SETENV} ${MAKE_ENV} \
          ./build -os ${ECLIPSE_OS} -ws ${ECLIPSE_WS} -arch ${ECLIPSE_ARCH}
-compilelibs)

do-install:
        @${MKDIR} ${PORTDESTDIR}
        @${TAR} -xvzf ${WRKSRC}/result/*.tar.gz -C ${PREFIX}
        @${SED} \
          -e "s+%%ECLIPSE_HOME%%+${PORTDESTDIR}+g" \
          -e "s+%%JAVA_HOME%%+${JAVA_HOME}+g" \
          -e "s+%%X11BASE%%+${X11BASE}+g" \
          -e "s+%%BROWSER%%+${BROWSER}+g" \
        ${FILESDIR}/eclipse.in > ${WRKSRC}/eclipse.tmp
        ${INSTALL_SCRIPT} ${WRKSRC}/eclipse.tmp ${PREFIX}/bin/eclipse
        ${INSTALL_PROGRAM} ${WRKSRC}/launchertmp/eclipse
${PREFIX}/eclipse/eclipse
        @(cd ${WRKSRC}/tmp; ${FIND} -s eclipse -not -type d | ${GREP} -v
tmp.tar) >> ${TMPPLIST}
        @(cd ${WRKSRC}/tmp; ${FIND} -s -d eclipse -type d) \

          | ${SED} -ne 's,^,@dirrm ,p' >> ${TMPPLIST}

.include <bsd.port.post.mk>

B. Symptoms
*****************************************************
Session data is:
java.version=1.5.0-p1
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=freebsd, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en
Command-line arguments:  -os freebsd -ws gtk -arch x86

---------------------------------------------
1. Help > Help contents brings up browser with location:
http://127.0.0.1:54537/help/index.jsp
And Error report:
"The document that you have requested is not available. The link may be
 wrong, or you may not have the corresponding product feature installed."


2. Help > Search produces pop-up Indexing error and  event details:
------------
Error 2005-06-05 08:51:05.229 Errors while indexing

(In reply to comment #2)
> FreeBSD is not the supported OS for Eclipse 3.1.

ec lipse is open source software and is java. Both criteria mean that the
concept of "unsuported OS" is irrelevant - especially as the identical bug is
top be found on other platforms. The source code is open source - itmay be true
that siome people working on the project are not themselves familiar with
FreeBSD but the FreeBSD eclipse project maintainer is familiar with with
freebsd. Please let us concentrate on having fun and providing mutual support
within the open source community. This source code was donated by ibm to the
open source community and therefore belo0ngs to everyone.

Absolutely. But there is a difference between the Eclipse community as a whole 
and the current Eclipse project committers. The later have taken on a task to 
produce a release on a set schedule that is tested on a predetermined set of 
OS/WS/JRE combinations. We are interested in porting Eclipse to other 
platforms but that would require contributions from others. In case of help 
system, we are not seeing the reported problem on the supported platforms, so 
it must be something specific to your OS configuration. We will be more than 
happy to accept a patch once you investigate the priblem and find the cause. 
Failing that, we must limit our cycles to ensuring that Help works on the 
platforms set out in advance in the 3.1 plan. After the release, we well have 
more time to assist you in your efforts.

From Eclipse Platform's 3.1 test plan:

<quote>
There are many different implementations of the Java 2 Platform running atop a 
variety of operating systems. We focus Eclipse testing on a handful of popular 
combinations of operating system and Java 2 Platform; these are our reference 
platforms. Eclipse undoubtedly runs fine in many operating environments beyond 
the reference platforms we test. However, since we do not systematically test 
them we cannot vouch for them. Problems encountered when running Eclipse on 
non-reference platform that cannot be recreated on any reference platform will 
be given lower priority than problems with running Eclipse on a reference 
platform.
</quote>

Please stop dragging companies Eclipse committers happen to work for into this 
discussion. All Eclipse committers operate strictly according to the Eclipse 
Project Charter and the current project plans. According to the snippet above, 
it is a declared fact that we will give lower priority to problems occuring on 
non-reference platforms. Lower priority means that we will look at them during 
normal bug triage at non-peak periods. We are at the final stages of the 3.1 
release and must make hard choices regarding what to look at and what to defer 
for after 3.1. It happens all the time and your problem is just one of them.

We did find bugs in tomcat and lucene open source software we used. Because it 
was important to us, we provided a fix and contributed the fix back into the 
respective OS community.

Please only report technical information that may solve this bug (for you or 
others) here.  Patches are also welcome and may be attached.  They will be 
reviewed by existing committers before being released.
Please take your attidue and non technical comments elsewhere, far enough that 
they do not spam mailoboxes of people genuinly interested in quality of Hhelp 
component.
Thank you.

Eclipse Help system can be launched in two modes - embedded (when the browser 
widget is embedded in an Eclipse window) and external (when an external 
browser program is launched to show a particular URL).

If you want to track down problems with the embedded browsers, SWT Developers 
page has snippets to quickly get embedded test cases up and running. They are 
useful to isolate problems strictly related to the embedded browser widget.

External browser is configurable in the General>Web Browser preferences. 

Help preference page controls whether internal or external browser is used. 
External browser is forced if embedded browser is not supported on a 
particular platform.

Off the top of my head, search issues look to me like tmp dir permission 
problem (but I may be mistaken). I have seen that the search lock file has r 
permissions for others and group and rw for root. This may be a problem if you 
are launching Eclipse as a non-root. Of course, this does not address XP 
problems.

Bug now fixed for FreeBSD by means of patch - usr latest freebsd
ports/java/eclipse-devel after cvsup ports-all cd to
/usr/ports/java/eclipse-devel . If you have a previous version of eclipse
installed then make clean and make deinstall. Compile with "make -D
with_mozilla" and "make -D with_mozilla install".
You will need to mv any existing workspace in your user directory or rename it
if you wish to use the default home/user/workspace. Existing projects can be
moved into the new workspace.
Before running the program make sure it will run with read/write permission  /var/db
Anyone who feel this information may be useful for solving the dame bug on other
platforms might like to take a look at a copy of the freebsd ports  Makefile and
scripts which can be downloaded from www.freebsd.org follow the links to
ports>java>eclipse-devel.

Thanks to all who helped and especially to the Freebsd java/eclipse ports team
who did all the hard work on this.
